#Text=Vicente de Zaldívar
#Text=Vicente de Zaldívar ( c. 1573-before 1650 ) was a Spanish soldier and explorer in New Mexico .
#Text=He led the Spanish force which perpetrated the Acoma Massacre at the Acoma Pueblo in 1599 .
#Text=He led or participated in several expeditions onto the Great Plains .
#Text=Early life
#Text=Vicente de Zaldívar was born circa 1573 . [ 2 ]
#Text=The Zaldivar and Oñate families of Zacatecas and New Mexico were prominent and intertwined .
#Text=His father , Vicente de Zaldívar , Sr. , served in the Chichimeca War of 1550-1590 and other wars alongside his uncle ( thus Vicente 's great-uncle ) , Cristóbal de Oñate . [ 3 ]
#Text=His mother was Magdalena de Mendoza y Salazar . [ 2 ]
#Text=He had a brother , Juan de Zaldívar . [ 2 ] Juan de Oñate , the founder of the Spanish colony of New Mexico in 1598 , was their uncle and second cousin . [ 2 ] [ 3 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=In 1595 , Zaldívar was appointed Sargento mayor by his uncle , Juan de Oñate , in their colonization of New Mexico for the Spanish Crown . [ 2 ] [ 3 ]
#Text=They arrived in New Mexico in 1598 . [ 2 ]
#Text=Buffalo hunting .
#Text=Food and resources were scarce in the young colony of New Mexico .
#Text=On September 15 , 1598 , Zaldivar and his guide , Jusepe Gutierrez , led a group of 60 men onto the Great Plains to determine whether Bison , the American buffalo , could be domesticated .
#Text=Departing from Pecos Pueblo , Zaldivar journeyed 57 leagues eastward , about 250 kilometres ( 160mi ) , probably to the Canadian River valley .
#Text=There he found huge herds of buffalo .
#Text=Zaldivar and his men constructed a large corral in which they attempted to capture several thousand buffalo .
#Text=The buffalo were recalcitrant and killed three horses and wounded 40 more .
#Text=Zaldivar then captured a number of buffalo calves , but all of them quickly died .
#Text=Failing in the attempt to domesticate buffalo , Zaldivar focused instead on hunting and returned to the Spanish settlements with 80 arobas , about 1,000 kilograms ( 2,200lb ) of buffalo fat .
#Text=He proclaimed buffalo meat superior to the beef of Spanish cows .
#Text=Zaldivar and his men arrived back at the Spanish settlements on November 8 , 1598 . [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=Acoma .

#Text=After his brother and other Spaniards were killed by Native Americans at Acoma Pueblo in New Mexico on December 4 , 1598 , Zaldívar was promoted to Maestre de Campo , second in command to Oñate . [ 2 ] In January 1599 , Zaldívar avenged his brother 's death in an attack on Acoma , culminating in the Acoma Massacre in which hundreds of Acomans were killed or enslaved . [ 2 ]
#Text=Poet Gaspar Pérez de Villagrá subsequently wrote a poem about his victory . [ 3 ]
#Text=Jumano War .
#Text=Zaldívar was maestro de campo in the expedition to Quivira in 1601 . [ 3 ]
#Text=During that process , he encountered the Jumano people and served in the Jumano War of 1601 . [ 3 ]
#Text=Later life .
#Text=Zaldívar received the Order of Santiago in 1626 . [ 2 ]
#Text=Personal life
#Text=Zaldívar married María de Oñate , who was his cousin ( Juan de Oñate 's daughter ) . [ 2 ]
#Text=They had an only son , Nicolas de Zaldívar y Oñate , who was later appointed Adelantado . [ 3 ] [ 6 ]
#Text=Death
#Text=Zaldívar died by 1650 . [ 2 ]
